definition: trembling with fear/with fear and trepidation

sentences.english: Hear the word of the LORD, ye that tremble at his word;
sentences.chinese: 你们因耶和华言语战兢的人，当听他的话。

sentences.english: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.
sentences.chinese: 因此我心战兢，从原处移动。

sentences.english: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction: and the curtains of the land of Midian did tremble.
sentences.chinese: 我见古珊的帐棚遭难，米甸的幔子战兢。

sentences.english: Notice also the reference to fear and trembling.
sentences.chinese: 注意在这里提到恐惧战兢。

sentences.english: Shaking came on them and pain, as on a woman in childbirth.
sentences.chinese: 他们在那里被战兢疼痛抓住，好像产难的妇人一样。

sentences.english: Trembling seized them there, pain like that of a woman in labor.
sentences.chinese: 他们在那里被战兢疼痛抓住，好像产难的妇人一样。

sentences.english: The isles saw it, and feared; the ends of the earth were afraid, drew near, and came.
sentences.chinese: 海岛看见就都害怕，地极也都战兢，就近前来。

sentences.english: Tremble, ye women that are at ease;
Work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.
sentences.chinese: 就当恐惧战兢做成你们得救的工夫。

sentences.english: The sight was so terrifying that Moses said, "I am trembling with fear. ""
sentences.chinese: 所见的极其可怕，甚至摩西说，我甚是恐惧战兢。

sentences.english: Fear took hold upon them there, and pain, as of a woman in travail.
sentences.chinese: 他们在那里被战兢疼痛抓住，好像产难的妇人一样。

definition: variant of 撒旦[Sa1 dan4], Satan or Shaitan
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
memorial tablet in a temple commemorating a deceased father
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
